node.title: Bird life 'bonanza', productivity set to double in Lower Lachlan as water reaches flood plains
node.alt: Aerial photo of water arriving to floodplains, water pattern is like a green tree stretching across grey country
node.description: Floods devastated farmers in the NSW Central West, but further down the riverÂ landholders are rejoicing in the arrival of floodwaters.
node.content:
["This year, floods have devastated landholders in the NSW Central West, inundating millions of dollars worth of crops just as they were ready to harvest.", "However, further down the Lachlan River, western Riverina farmers and environmentalists are rejoicing in the arrival of water to the flood plains and wetlands.\u00a0", "Senior environment water manager Joanne Lenehan was part of a group that surveyed the flood plains last week, including the Booligal Wetlands and Great Cumbung Swamp.", "Dr Lenehan said the water was supporting a \"bonanza\" of bird activity.", "\"What was quite interesting is the actual Lachlan River is not the dominant visual feature in the landscape at the moment,\" Dr\u00a0Lenehan said.\u00a0", "\"But it does continue to play a vital role in creating thousands and thousands of habitats \u2026 as water spreads out across this vast flood plain.\"", "", "
Senior environmental water manager\u00a0Joanne Lenehan conducting pelican breeding surveys on the Lachlan flood plains.(Supplied: Mal Carnegie)
", "The survey, conducted both from the air and the ground, discovered significant breeding events and detected rare threatened species.\u00a0", "\"We actually confirmed the expansion of an existing colony \u2026\u00a0these are predominantly straw-necked, glossy and white ibis colonies that we are now monitoring,\" Ms Lenehan said.\u00a0", "", "
A straw-necked ibis in the Lower Lachlan flood plain.(Supplied: Warren Chad)
", "
Floodwaters take months to reach the end of the catchment
", "The water currently filling the flood plains is largely a result of releases made from the Lachlan Valley's Wyangala Dam in August and September.", "It will take weeks for the peak of the recent floods to reach the lower end of the catchment, but its arrival is poised to extend waterbird breeding events over summer.", "", "
Rain clears over the Lower Lachlan flood plains.(Supplied: Mal Carnegie)
", "
Productivity set to double for the next two years
", "Booligal grazier Hugh McLean said the floodwaters would add millions of dollars in farm revenue for the Hay and Balranald regions.", "\"At a very simplistic level, where you have inundation, you will basically double the productivity of that area of land for about 24 months. So, it's substantial.\"", "", "
A Ballion's crake spotted in the Lower Lachlan wetlands during last week's survey.(Supplied: Warren Chad)
", "
Wyangala Dam debate continues
", "The November floods around Forbes supported the state government's proposed expansion of Wyangala Dam, with the project's advocates arguing raising the dam's wall would improve flood mitigation.\u00a0", "However, the Lachlan Floodplain and Wetland Group believes the project could lead to economic and environmental losses in their region.\u00a0", "", "
Water pouring out of Wyangala Dam in November.(Supplied: John Batcheldor)
", "Mr McLean,\u00a0a member of the group, said the project could push dam spill events out to every 10 to 15 years instead of every five to 10 years.\u00a0", "\"It will also change the flow regime of flood events. You won't have that high river that allows water to burst the banks, get into the critical wetland environments and inundate the flood plains.\u00a0"]
